meanings.definition: To provide a date line for (a newspaper article)
meanings.sent1: The journalist datelined her article with today's date.
meanings.sent2: The newspaper always datelines their stories with the current date.
meanings.sent3: I wonder if I should dateline my shopping list to keep track of when I wrote it.
meanings.sent4: Her memories were datelined with the events of that summer, making them easy to recall.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to dateline their essays to ensure they were completed on time.

meanings.definition: To indicate the date and place of origin of (a news dispatch)
meanings.sent1: The reporter datelined the breaking news from the scene of the accident.
meanings.sent2: Every news report is datelined to show where and when it was written.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally datelined my email from yesterday as if it was sent today.
meanings.sent4: The old photograph was datelined with the year it was taken, bringing back memories.
meanings.sent5: The map was datelined with the locations of all the important landmarks in the city.
